thread.title: January Private Sector Job Growth Outpaces Projections, 246,000 Jobs Added
thread.title_full: January Private Sector Job Growth Outpaces Projections, 246,000 Jobs Added

author: Andrew Mark Miller
title: January Private Sector Job Growth Outpaces Projections, 246,000 Jobs Added
text:
03:18pm February 1, 2017   
We have seen plenty of indicators that Donald Trump is about to preside over a growth economy. 
The stock market exploded when he won the election. 
The dollar got stronger. 
Several major companies like Ford, SoftBank, Walmart, and GM pledged major investments and significant job creation. 
Trump has even talked about 4% growth. 
That would be a nice change of pace from the worst recovery since World War II that we saw under Obama. 
Now, some more good news. 
January job growth was stronger than expected… 
From The Daily Caller : 
The U.S. private sector added 246,000 new jobs in January, outpacing economists projections for the start of 2017. 
Economists polled by Reuters and Econoday originally expected the private employers to add between 140,000 to 200,000 jobs in January. Even the most robust estimates fell some 25 percent short of the realized private sector employment gains. January was the fastest pace of job growth since June of last year. 
Can’t argue with that. 
Things are looking up.
